attributes.action: Shifting Financial Responsibility for Vehicle Theft Consequences
attributes.additional_details: Currently, victims of car theft often suffer twice—first losing their vehicle, then facing increased insurance costs. This is unfair and punishes innocent people. Many thefts happen in areas with inadequate security. Shifting some responsibility to councils would push for better safety and accountability.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to change the law so that victims of car theft are not financially penalised by higher insurance premiums. Local authorities should share responsibility when

rejection.details: We're not sure exactly what you'd like Local Councils to do. You could start a new petition setting this out more clearly.
